summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from November 2021 between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls, and coordinating the identification and subpoena of a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Appears to be an attorney at the law firm WilmerHale, corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding scheduling and witness coordination for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, copied on the email chain discussing trial preparation and witness coordination for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Mentioned as a person with whom a call is to be scheduled; likely a representative or witness from JPMorgan Chase.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced throughout the email chain, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Corresponding as legal professionals on opposite sides (defense and prosecution) of the Ghislaine Maxwell case, coordinating on scheduling and witness matters.
Stoddart is arranging a call between the prosecution team and Pat McHugh, suggesting a professional connection, likely related to JPMorgan's involvement.
Sahni, as a prosecutor, is working on the case against the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Jury selection is mentioned as being underway, making scheduling difficult for the legal teams.

events.title: Request for Trial Subpoena to JPMorgan
events.description: Allison Stoddart requests that the prosecution provide a trial appearance subpoena for a witness from JPMorgan Chase.

keyFacts: The emails show active coordination between the defense (via WilmerHale attorney Allison Stoddart) and the prosecution (AUSA Anjan Sahni) in the lead-up to Ghislaine Maxwell's trial in late 2021.
A key topic is identifying and subpoenaing a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase, indicating the bank's potential involvement or possession of relevant evidence.
The correspondence highlights the logistical challenges of scheduling during the jury selection phase of the high-profile trial.
The document is part of the discovery or pre-trial coordination process in case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
